alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 10:51PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherokee County through 1115 PM CDT... At 1051 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ball Flat, or near Piedmont, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Forney, Pleasant Gap, Tennala, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Ball Flat, Coloma, Howells Crossroads, Waterhouse and Spring Garden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
